title: 820–00165 as soon as the Power button is pressed fan at high speed
message:

it will be a very interesting experience for me, and because it is the first apple laptop that I repair.
What do you say about what TG Pro shows ?
Apple test (ATH ?) shows two mistakes
battery  PPT004 
fann   PPPF003 

fan connector:
J6000   1.  PP5V_S0   5.10V
             2.  FAN_RT_TACH    1.62V
             3.  FAN_RT_PWM   4.65V
             4.  GND   OK



Where should I start the diagnosis?

title: 820–00165 as soon as the Power button is pressed fan at high speed
message: U6010  looks like it has never been soldered

title: 820–00165 as soon as the Power button is pressed fan at high speed
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Try known goof trackpad board/flex.
If still the same, then try LIO board/flex.
Also start disconnecting webcam.

connected board LIO with J7000
after connecting the power supply, the fan starts after about three seconds

title: 820–00165 as soon as the Power button is pressed fan at high speed

Is normal to have high fan spin if you disconnect trackpad and/or LIO board.
I said disconnect webcam, nothing else.
REPLACE trackpad and LIO board/flex for test...

title: 820–00165 as soon as the Power button is pressed fan at high speed
message:
parts came, I replaced the tack pad, DC Board, flex   I changed everything in one go  (the fan works as it should)
I started replacing the old parts to find out what exactly was damaged, I put in All the old parts of the fault I did not find the fan works normally on the old parts.
the flex between the tracpad and the motherboard was corroded and dirty (I replaced it with a new one)   :-(

the motherboard could be damaged by the liquid, I don't know anything about it.

the new problem is the shutdown time is extremely long, around 5 minutes, and my CPU is getting very hot during this time

any ideas to fix this problem?

title: 820–00165 as soon as the Power button is pressed fan at high speed
message:
Do you mean that machine takes 5 min to turns off?
Boot USB macOS and check if same.
If yes, do PRAM reset 2-3 times.
You can also try clean ME BIOS...

title: 820–00165 as soon as the Power button is pressed fan at high speed

is this normal or should it show zero ?

title: 820–00165 as soon as the Power button is pressed fan at high speed
message:
22mA from charger could be normal, just compare with other laptop.
3V3_S5/SUS power rails are still active.

Did you try full BIOS clean ME, or just clean ME in the backup?

title: 820–00165 as soon as the Power button is pressed fan at high speed
message: just clean ME in the backup

title: 820–00165 as soon as the Power button is pressed fan at high speed
message: Try new full BIOS, to discard any corruption of your backup, not just ME region.
